tn.ref: I said in my heart
tn.text: AT: "I said to myself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: I will test you with happiness
tn.text: Here the word "you" refers himself. AT: "I will test myself with things that make me happy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: So enjoy pleasure
tn.text: AT: "So I will enjoy things that please me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: I said about laughter, "It is crazy,"
tn.text: AT: "I said that it is crazy to laugh at things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: What use is it?
tn.text: AT: "It is useless" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: I explored in my heart
tn.text: AT: "I thought hard about" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: to gratify my desires with wine
tn.text: AT: "to use wine to make myself happy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: I let my mind guide me with wisdom
tn.text: AT: "I thought about the things that wise people had taught me"

tn.ref: during the days of their lives
tn.text: AT: "as long as they live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I built houses for myself and planted vineyards
tn.text: The writer probably told people to do the work. AT: "I had people build houses and plant vineyards for me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: gardens and parks
tn.text: These two words share similar meanings and refer to beautiful orchards of fruit trees. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: to water a forest
tn.text: "to provide water for a forest"

tn.ref: forest where trees were grown
tn.text: AT: "forest where trees grew" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I had slaves born in my palace
tn.text: AT: "I had slaves that were born in my palace" or "My slaves bore children and they also were my slaves"

tn.ref: the treasures of kings and provinces
tn.text: This refers to the gold and other wealth that neighboring countries were forced to pay to the king of Israel.

tn.ref: delights from the children of mankind, concubines and wives
tn.text: AT: "I greatly enjoyed my many wives and concubines, as any man would"

tn.ref: my wisdom remained with me
tn.text: "I continued to act wisely" or "I continued to be wise"

tn.ref: Whatever my eyes desired
tn.text: AT: "Whatever I saw and desired" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: I did not withhold from them
tn.text: This can be stated positively. AT: "I got for myself"

tn.ref: I did not withhold my heart from any pleasure
tn.text: This can be stated positively. AT: "I allowed myself to enjoy everything that made me happy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: my heart rejoiced
tn.text: AT: "I rejoiced"

tn.ref: all the deeds that my hands had accomplished
tn.text: AT: "all that I had accomplished" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: vapor and an attempt to shepherd the wind
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:12|1:14]].

tn.ref: madness and folly
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:16|1:17]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: For what can the next king do ... which has not already been done?
tn.text: The writer uses this question to emphasize his point that the next king will not be able to do anything more valuable that what he had already done. AT: "For the next king can do nothing ... which has not already been done." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: the next king ... who comes after the king
tn.text: "the king ... who succeeds the current king." This was probably written by the current king, so "after the king" could also be translated as "after me" (UDB).

tn.ref: wisdom has advantages over folly, just as light is better than darkness
tn.text: Wisdom his better than folly, just as light is better than darkness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: The wise man uses his eyes in his head to see where he is going
tn.text: AT: "The wise man is like a person who uses his eyes to see where he is going" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: uses his eyes in his head to see
tn.text: AT: "can see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the fool walks in darkness
tn.text: AT: "the fool is like a person who walks in the dark" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I said in my heart
tn.text: AT: "I said to myself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: So what difference does it make if I am very wise?
tn.text: The writer uses this question to emphasize his point that there is no benefit to being wise. AT: "So it makes no difference if I am very wise." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: I concluded in my heart
tn.text: AT: "I concluded"

tn.ref: vapor
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:12|1:14]].

tn.ref: the wise man, like the fool, is not remembered for very long
tn.text: AT: "people will not remember the wise man for very long, just as they do not remember the fool for very long" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: everything will have been long forgotten
tn.text: AT: "people will have long forgotten everything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: all the work done
tn.text: AT: "all the work that people do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: vapor and an attempt to shepherd the wind
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:12|1:14]].

tn.ref: For who knows whether he will be a wise man or a fool?
tn.text: AT: "For no one knows whether he will be a wise man or a fool." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: he will be
tn.text: "he" refers to the person who will inherit Solomon's wealth.

tn.ref: my heart began to despair
tn.text: AT: "I began to despair" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: a great tragedy
tn.text: "a great disaster"

tn.ref: For what profit does the person gain who works so hard and tries in his heart to complete his labors under the sun?
tn.text: AT: "For the person who works so hard and tries in his heart to complete his labors under the sun gains nothing." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: works so hard and tries in his heart
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize how strenuously the person works. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: tries in his heart
tn.text: AT: "tries anxiously" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: painful and stressful
tn.text: These two words mean basically the same thing and emphasize how difficult the person's work is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: his soul does not find rest
tn.text: AT: "his mind does not rest" or "he continues to worry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: this truth comes from God's hand
tn.text: AT: "this truth comes from God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: For who can eat or who can have any kind of pleasure apart from God?
tn.text: AT: "For no one can eat or have any kind of pleasure apart from God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: so that he may give it away to someone who pleases God
tn.text: The word "he" may refer either to God or to the sinner. The word "it" refers to what the sinner has gathered and stored. The following translation is one way of saying this without making it clear who it is that gives the things that were stored. AT: "so that the one who pleases God may have it"

tn.ref: vapor and an attempt to shepherd the wind
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:12|1:14]].
